title: Graph embedding
summary: In topological graph theory, an embedding (also spelled imbedding) of a graph G {\displaystyle G} on a surface Σ {\displaystyle \Sigma } is a representation of G {\displaystyle G} on Σ {\displaystyle \Sigma } in which points of Σ {\displaystyle \Sigma } are associated with vertices and simple arcs (homeomorphic images of [ 0 , 1 ] {\displaystyle [0,1]} ) are associated with edges in such a way that:
